docs.lead_paragraph: CVS drugstores that quit tobacco sales last year are now getting health and beauty makeovers and a shot of ethnic diversity in some cases to attract customers who want more than a prescription refill.

headline.main: CVS Health Launches Health, Beauty Makeover for Drugstores
headline.print_headline: CVS Health Launches Health, Beauty Makeover for Drugstores

docs.snippet: CVS drugstores that quit tobacco sales last year are now getting health and beauty makeovers and a shot of ethnic diversity in some cases to attract customers who want more than a prescription refill.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the U.S. Supreme Court prepares to rule on whether people in 34 states can continue to receive Obamacare health insurance subsidies, economists are projecting billions of dollars in lost healthcare spending for hospitals, drugstores and drugmakers if the justices say the payments are illegal.

headline.main: Economists Predict Shockwaves if Obamacare Subsidies Are Nixed
headline.print_headline: Economists Predict Shockwaves if Obamacare Subsidies Are Nixed

docs.snippet: As the U.S. Supreme Court prepares to rule on whether people in 34 states can continue to receive Obamacare health insurance subsidies, economists are projecting billions of dollars in lost healthcare spending for hospitals, drugstores and drugmakers...

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Republicans will move to temporarily continue health care subsidies for millions of people if the Supreme Court overturns the aid, according to plans discussed Wednesday in the House and Senate.

headline.main: Congressional GOP Plans to Continue Health Law Subsidies
headline.print_headline: Congressional GOP Plans to Continue Health Law Subsidies

docs.snippet: Congressional Republicans will move to temporarily continue health care subsidies for millions of people if the Supreme Court overturns the aid, according to plans discussed Wednesday in the House and Senate.

docs.lead_paragraph: Austrian Chancellor Werner Faymann expressed solidarity with Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras before meeting the leader in Athens on Wednesday in a bid to end a standoff with international creditors over a rescue package.

headline.main: Austrian Chancellor Sides With Greece in Debt Row
headline.print_headline: Austrian Chancellor Sides With Greece in Debt Row

docs.snippet: Austrian Chancellor Werner Faymann expressed solidarity with Greek Prime Minister Alexis Tsipras before meeting the leader in Athens on Wednesday in a bid to end a standoff with international creditors over a rescue package.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Jerry Brown and legislative leaders announced Tuesday that they had reached a deal on $115.4 billion in spending for the fiscal year that begins July 1.
docs.abstract: California lawmakers and Gov Jerry Brown say they have reached agreement on $115.4 billion budget for fiscal year starting in July 2015.
docs.snippet: Gov. Jerry Brown and legislative leaders announced Tuesday that they had reached a deal on $115.4 billion in spending for the fiscal year that begins July 1.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was not an easy transition for Katherine Boone, but the question is no longer whether gender reassignment is an option, but instead how soon it should start.

headline.main: The New Girl in School: Transgender Surgery at 18
headline.print_headline: New Girl in School: Transgender Surgery at 18

docs.abstract: Emerging debate over minimum age at which patients should be allowed to undergo gender reassignment surgery is embodied by 18-year-old Katherine Boone's transition from male to female; some have argued for raising minimum age for some procedures to 21, while some doctors argue that it is easier to enact successful transition at puberty; overarching arguments center on nature of gender dysphoria and whether people should be allowed to make such decisions in changeable teenage years.
docs.snippet: It was not an easy transition for Katherine Boone, but the question is no longer whether gender reassignment is an option, but instead how soon it should start.

docs.lead_paragraph: Top House and Senate Republicans plan to brief rank-and-file lawmakers on Wednesday on their plans should the Supreme Court erase federal subsidies under President Barack Obama's health care law, congressional aides said.

headline.main: AP Sources: Hill Leaders to Brief Lawmakers on Health Care
headline.print_headline: AP Sources: Hill Leaders to Brief Lawmakers on Health Care

docs.snippet: Top House and Senate Republicans plan to brief rank-and-file lawmakers on Wednesday on their plans should the Supreme Court erase federal subsidies under President Barack Obama's health care law, congressional aides said.

docs.lead_paragraph: A police chief in a small New England city combating its drug epidemic through a unique program that allows drug users to turn over their drugs and get immediate treatment said Tuesday that there's been a strong early response.

headline.main: Police Tout Success in Unique Fight Against Drug Epidemic
headline.print_headline: Police Tout Success in Unique Fight Against Drug Epidemic

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has approved plans by Arkansas, Delaware and Pennsylvania to create their own state-based health insurance marketplaces instead of relying on a federal website to enroll residents, a government spokesman said on Tuesday.

headline.main: U.S. Approves Plans for Three States Set Up Obamacare Exchanges
headline.print_headline: U.S. Approves Plans for Three States Set Up Obamacare Exchanges

docs.snippet: The Obama administration has approved plans by Arkansas, Delaware and Pennsylvania to create their own state-based health insurance marketplaces instead of relying on a federal website to enroll residents, a government spokesman said on Tuesday.
